# VirtualScrollerInitialParams.estimatedWidgetSize property

Estimated size of scroll element.

**Signature:**

```typescript
estimatedWidgetSize?: number;
```

## Remarks

Actual size is always reported by `ResizeObserver`<!-- -->, but this property together with [VirtualScrollerRuntimeParams.estimatedItemSize](/virtual/reference/virtual-core.virtualscrollerruntimeparams.estimateditemsize) and [VirtualScrollerRuntimeParams.overscanCount](/virtual/reference/virtual-core.virtualscrollerruntimeparams.overscancount) can be used in server-side rendering.

Quantity of SSR-rendered elements can be calculated this way:

```typescript
Math.min( itemCount, Math.ceil( estimatedWidgetSize / estimatedItemSize ) + overscanCount )
```
